newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends weak as banks seek US dlrs.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends weak as banks seek US dlrs.

text.p: Bangladesh taka closed slightly easier at 42.2300/42.2400 to the dollar in interbank trading compared with the previous closing at 42.2250/42.2350, dealers said.

Dealers said the taka slipped after opening at 42.2250/42.2450 as banks bought dollars to keep long positions. There was, however, no demand for dollars from importers because of the weekend closure of most global markets, they said.
Dealers said the interbank call money rates closed unchanged at 4.0 percent to 4.25 percent.
